channel.title: How do I get noticed more?
channel.description: Just some tips on how to get more followers and promoted? Anything that you think can help me would be appreciated :)

item.title: How do I get noticed more?
item.dc:creator: MR_ANDERSON
item.description:
One thing you could try to do sometime is collaborate with an already popular artist. Not all artists will agree to it, but its always worth a shot. Many months ago, I did a collaboration with @Southborne. It was when almost no one knew about me! Anyway, doing this may both promote your profile, as well as get you valuable experience with a more trained producer (which, really, is the most valuable part of it all, whether or not you get noticed more through it or not).

Read full topic
item.source: How do I get noticed more?

item.dc:creator: crystldawnmusic
item.description:
What not to do:

HEY @EVERYONE I JUST DROPPED A NEW SONG IT’S RIGHT HERE (LINK)
GO FOLLOW ME RIGHT NOW @EVERYONE @EVERYONE

Read full topic
item.source: How do I get noticed more?

item.title: How do I get noticed more?
item.dc:creator: tornait
item.description:
Constantly work to get better, mate. Strive to get better. Find places and start the flow of tracks, and get yourself out there. There are numerous Discord servers I put my music on. Those alone help me get a good amount of plays.

And then… strive to get reposted. And maybe get Auxy to follow you. For that, really try to create your own sound and do your own thing. Try to be as different as possible.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I get noticed more?

item.title: How do I get noticed more?
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
Sunny:

When you hand your stuff to a DJ, is it more likely they’ll accept remixes of popular songs over original tracks?

They’ll play anything they like, but if your goal is to get a track signed, I think original songs would be a better option.

Read full topic

item.source: How do I get noticed more?

item.title: How do I get noticed more?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
I think the ‘modern’ equivalent of that might be getting your track on a Spotify playlist or posted on one of the big promo YouTube channels, such Majestic Casual, MrSuicideSheep, TheSoundYouNeed, etc… or one of the genre-specific ones, like TrapNation.

I do agree that SC Plays and Likes aren’t something we should necessarily measure success by, they can be a useful indicator of which tracks work and which perhaps don’t.
It can certainly be useful promo to get a Repost from more influential SCers, for the same reason that getting a DJ to play it still works.

 
Fwiw…

LANDR Blog: 5 Social Media Metrics Musicians Think About All Wrong

Read full topic
item.source: How do I get noticed more?

item.title: How do I get noticed more?
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
Call me old fashioned, but I still think sending (or handing) your music to DJs is still the way to go.

One play on a prominent radio station, or at a knowledgable club is better than any number of superficial likes on Soundcloud IMO.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I get noticed more?

item.title: How do I get noticed more?
item.dc:creator: Sunny
item.description:
Nope, no-one gets discovered online. Live bands playing original songs may get discovered by talent agents, but EDM producers work very hard to feature their music through generating hype for their work via networking, cross posting, and promoting. Not all promotions are paid, like being featured in BTC or competitions.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I get noticed more?
